property.name: text
property.value:
The EM algorithm is implemented as an SDF model, which is completely run for a number of iterations defined by the user with the EMiterations parameter.
The number of samples that are drawn from the mixture model is defined by the Ns parameter. The model is run for different number of samples and the convergence rate of the EM algorithm as a function of the number of samples available is demonstrated.

property.name: Title
property.value: Gaussian Mixture Model Generation and Expectation Maximization for Parameter Estimation

property.name: text
property.value:
The Gaussian Mixture Model(GMM) is parameterized by mu: the mean vector sigma: the vector containing the standard deviation values priors: mixture probabilities of the Gaussian densities
Each Gaussian component in the GMM is specified by the distribution
X_i ~ N(mu(i), sigma(i))
where i is the array index common to mu, sigma and priors.

property.name: text
property.value: This model learns the means and variances of the Gaussian random variables in a Gaussian Mixture Model (GMM), where data from multiple Gaussian distributions is randomly combined. It an Expectation Maximization algorithm.

entity.name: Gaussian
entity.doc: Create a sequence of gaussian random variables

entity.doc: Create a sequence of gaussian random variables

entity.name: ChooseIndex
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

property.name: text
property.value: The outer loop of the EM algorithm. The estimates are iterated for 'nIterations' number of times before the final result is delivered. The Mean Square Error between the actual parameters and the estimates are also outputs of this level

property.name: text
property.value: M-Step: Computing Parameter Estimates to be used in the next iteration
